comment: Overall in my opinion she was a solid professor, and did help me alot throughout the course. Even though I didn't get the grade I wanted, I feel like a lot of that had to do with my bad skills of deriving fractions. She wants you to succeed, and is willing to slow down her lectures if the class is struggling, would recommend taking her!

Overall, a good professor, and she is trying to get you to understand the material. I took her for the Summer semester in precalculus, and this was the easiest math class I had ever taken. You get a study guide that looks similar to the test, but make sure to do the assigned work and show up to class, and you will do well.

Russian Accent, but she does a great job conveying a course with almost a 30% DFW rate. Quizzes every week, but they serve you good. Think of them as "Checkpoints." She wants to see you pass, but you have to want to pass. The only thing hard about this course is the content Itself.

Somethings to get out of the way, yes professor Orlova has a slight accent. Yes, the lectures can be fast paced sometimes. But all in all, she's a good professor. She explains the concepts pretty well and the school offers a lot of support in Student Instructors and tutors. Please do expect to spend at least 5 hrs per week (at the least) on Calc

Dr. O is a wonderful Calc | Professor. She is amazing and offers lots of help to her students. She can be fast at times but will stop and answer any and all questions if you have one. She is very respectful and kind to her students. I highly recommend her if you are feeling anxious about Calc |. With her guidance, I was able to pass. She is AMAZING
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: TAKE HER FOR CALC1!! This prof cares about her students passing, available during office hours for help, gives advice, is straight up and blunt which helps. She gets to the point, asks if we understand before moving on, explains concepts beautifully. You really cannot go wrong with her class. Talk to her, be friendly ask questions and you'll pass.
Professor was really nice, was really fast in her lectures, barely did explanations, but provided lots of questions, her tests are an exact copy of the study guides she provides.
Amazing professor. All homework is on ALEXS and she gives study guides on it too. There is a good amount of homework and four knowledge checks along the way.

Lots of work through ALEKS, unlimited attempts on review.
4 tests & final, all on paper. 
You do need access to a printer, as you need to print your own worksheets for class. 
(Or you can use the PDF to follow along on.)
Chill and sweet, if you come to class & try. (Tough love if you're on your phone, or not in class.)
Great with accommodations!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: She has a thick accent but you can understand if you pay enough attention. Classes are fast-paced with daily little assignments that are minor inconveniences. You also have to print new assignments yourself before almost every class. Other than that, she is fine. I still learned the material so... don't be too afraid of taking her.

This professor struggles to effectively communicate the material, making it challenging for students to grasp key concepts. Her pace is quite rapid, and her explanations can be difficult to follow, which hinders the learning experience. PLEASE PICK SOMEONE ELSE
No extra credit, teaches really fast, i had to drop the class i don't recommend

Professor Orlova has a very thick accent which can make the lectures hard to understand. She also teaches very fast and in an unorganized way which made it difficult to focus. Does a lot of example problems without really going in depth on the topics. She is a sweet person just not a good professor in my opinion.

Hands down the worst professors at KSU. She does not care she just expect you to be like everyone else. She will get mad when you don't answer a question in .05 seconds. She also said that the school sent out an email to pass more students and help them and her response to that was "bs I will not" "I hope ksu reads this" HEAVY Russian accent.

Tests and quizzes are always easier than homework and classwork. Heavy accent, and she teaches really fast, so do your best not to get behind. Very sweet and always available for help outside class! She is very encouraging, especially toward students who are obviously trying to do well in the class. Would take her for calc 2 if she was teaching it!

Love her! She always offers help outside of class and is very understanding (I suffer from a panic disorder that caused me to reschedule a few quizzes). The only downside is that she teaches very fast and has a thick Eastern European accent, but once you get used to it it's not a big deal. Make sure if you miss class you learn the topics though!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Very amazing professor. She teaches fast but anything you may not understand from her, ALEKS will fill in. Do not be afraid to ask questions. I had a really rough year but emailed her and she was very responsive and understanding. As long as you are communicating your struggles and showing her you are putting in the work, she will help you.

The lectures are pretty pointless. I only learned the material from doing the HW. The class time is spent going over problems that never make it to the test, and she goes through them so fast it makes no sense. Attendance is mandatory, which makes it difficult to skip the lectures if you have already learned the material.

Ms. O was a great teacher, she can be hard on you but its for your benefit. She has an accent but shes quite easy to understand. If you do the homework you can pass every test with a 90+. Would defintily take her again if I had to.

Incoming freshmen of next year, don't take her class you want to be frustrated with her. This class is extremely accelerated. She thinks everyone is just as smart as her. You will blow through 7 topics in 10 minutes. She also says, "It shouldn't take you more than 3 seconds to solve this problem" which is absolute Bull Crap.

Incoming freshmen of next year, don't take her class you want to be frustrated with her. This class is extremely accelerated. She thinks everyone is just as smart as her. You will blow through 7 topics in 10 minutes. She also says, "It shouldn't take you more than 3 seconds to solve this problem" which is absolute BS.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: When you ask her for help she shrugged her shoulders, almost like she doesn't care about what you say. There is no point in going to her class unless less you are naturally talented at math. She only just solves problems up on the board and doesn't go into detail about them. If you're going to take her class will guess what I wouldn't.

Email her if you need her. From what I've heard, other math teachers just give you lectures while Professor Orlova gives you worksheets in class. She goes over them with you as a class. She does have an accent and she can go a bit fast but ALEKS fills in the gaps. You don't need to print anything just ask her for the assignment in class.

TAKE HER. Lots of work in class, but it was so helpful. Her tests are easy and straightforward. I got over a 100 in the class and she is such a nice woman. I love her and wish I could take her for the rest of my math classes.

She was a very awkward and shy professor, bc of this it was hard to understand what she was saying. She is nice and an easy grader, but don't rely on learning in the classroom bc you won't. Her methods are outdated and complicated they won't help in Calc2. Quiz each week and a solid amount of HW. Fairly easy class if you can teach yourself.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I hadn't taken Calculus in 10 years...and got a B+. Prof. O' has a bit of rigor to her class, but nothing is super difficult. Attendance is an extra grade. Quizzes and Tests come directly from Classroom assignment material covered. She is very caring, and extremely forgiving when grading...(did you do it right vs. correct answer)

She is AMAZING! Must take her bc she cares about the students and provides extra material on D2L which is extremely helpful. Reasonable homework, weekly quizzes, and 4 tests given. Write-in notes provided before each class which help you to focus on lectures. Take her if you can! Goes above and beyond for students to pass but they must study.

Beside getting use to the accent, Dr. O was an amazing professor. She explains topics well and will go back over them when asked too. Quizzes are weekly but only are few questions, and test are basically reworded quizzes. 10/10, would take again.

Great Professor. Class is straight forward. She does a good job explaining all scenarios for each problem. More than willing to go back and explain problems in detail. There is a lot of homework that is not taken as a completion grade, but she compensates for that by giving extra credit on all tests and quizzes. She is also a fair grader.

Professor O has been the best math teacher I have had. She is dedicated to helping you pass. Every week, there is a very short quiz on the material, super easy. The tests basically just look like the quizzes with different numbers. Attendance matters so show up to class! She notices those that put in the effort to pass and those that don't.

She is an awesome professor! Tests are very easy, and if you go to every lecture, and actually practice the daily assignments, you'll get an easy A!! She works very hard for students to pass, and is very understanding. Take her and you'll learn a lot! I wish I could take her for calc 2.

She was a great professor :) I liked her a lot. There was a 15 min quiz every week, super easy. 3 tests plus the final. Study the assignments you do in class and practice practice practice, calculus is all about doing the same problem over and over again.

Professor Orlova cares about her students and about teaching Calculus. But her class is by no means easy. There is ALOT of homework, coupled with 3 tests,final, along with quizzes every week. We learned something new up until the last day of class. Her class is not something you can coast through. But she works hard to help every student pass.

She is good at what she does when it comes to lectures. She makes an effort to ensure you sort of understand the material. Problems are there is a "short" quiz every week, no partial credit is given, no multiple-choice, and no corrections. Also, she teaches the next section before giving us the test for the previous. MyMathLab is a pain, lot of hw.

She is a very kind and helpful professor who wants students to learn. Her accent at first is a tad bit hard to understand but you eventually get over that. Her classes are slightly more self taught as ALEKS are a good focus on learning but if you do the homework and review (review and tests are very similar) you will be perfect.

Best Math Professor I've ever had, she truly wants you to pass her class. She is very generous with partial credit and goes over each test so you can understand your mistakes. Make sure you actually do the homework, the practice is imperative for success, if you can't finish by the deadline she is usually very lenient in extending them to help you.

Sweat but aggressive Professor at the same time. Very hard to understand. due to ALEK you will be okay. Just do your assignments on online and attend the class even you dont understand. If your not a math person I recommend you not too take her. You just basically teaching yourself that this point.

Great professor! Calculus is not an easy subject which may be the main indicator of this class's difficulty, not the professor. She does everything she can to ensure her students understand the material. She is accessible during office hours and WILL guide you step-by-step over any equations you may be dealing with. 10/10. She's hilarious as well.
She is a good teacher if you're good at math, if not I suggest to not take the class. it is solely based on what you do on Aleks and not much of her actually teaching.

I had Professor Ludmila for my Algebra class. And then Calculus. She is the best Math Professor I've ever had. The material is clear, she know how to teach and make you understand the material altough Calculus is a very difficult class. In addition, you can clearly see that she wants us to be successful in her class. Excellent Teacher!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: I had the choice to go in-person for a day each week but there was truly no point. She just teaches through Collaborate Ultra so I might as well stay home in my Pj's. She solely utilizes ALEKS for homework and tests and ALEKS teaches you almost all of it. It's a very easy class and I am horrible with math. She also responds fairly fast to emails.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: I loved her and the class! She is so kind and caring. You do get a good amount of homework on Aleks, but it's not too hard, because she goes over it in the class lectures. If you have a question or need further help, she will help you! The more homework, the more practice for the exams, and the higher chance of ending with a good grade!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: There is a lot of hw through the program ALEKS. She grades knowledge checks, which are used to figure out where you are in your learning, but if you aren't able to keep up, it will force you to re-do hw and she puts in a poor grade in the gradebook. If this happens, you may be locked out of future hw until you do prerequisite assignments.

If you are struggling with math before coming to KSU DO NOT TAKE HER COURSE! She gives no explanation on her lectures she goes through them as her students already know the content. The only learning you will be doing in this class is on ALEKS. All of the work is assigned on ALEKS. SHE DOES NOT TEACH!

Taking this calculus class fully online and during the summer was not easy. She seems very caring and works with her students. When answering questions you may be intimidated but overall not a hard class do the homework and show up for lecture and you should be ok. Also has an accent it is not hard to understand her though
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: She gives you daily homework, daily in-class work, and has an accent. You can majority of the time understand her, but if you don't and ask her to repeat she looks at you like you insulted her and half the time doesn't understand what you asked her. All test are online but have to come into the class to take the test, and sign it daily.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--So many papers

comment: She told us at the very beginning that "for every 30mins you are in my class you will spend an hour of homework" and she was not lying. I had to retake the class and did an Ecore class which was easier and much better. If you have take her class do her homework work as soon as it's available there is a lot.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: The class is pretty much all on Aleks, attendance is not that important but counts for a few points of your overall grade. Accent is hard to understand sometimes but yes it is bearable. The class is based off mainly on homework, tests and knowledge checks found on Aleks. Lessons are taught very quickly so you have to be on your game for whole semst
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I really love this wonderful Russian professor. She is extremely knowledgable, I would say a MASTER of mathematics. She will treat you as professional engineers that should already know the material, which makes you stay focused and on top of HW. I have come from Math Support after completing my Army service... If I can do it, anyone can do it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: The most boring lectures Ive ever been in. I have to show up to get a few extra points added ti my grade but its hard to because I find the classes so unbearable. And she doesnt really teach anything, just reviews homework youve already done. I learned more through the HW program, ALEKS, than I ever did from the professor. I hated this class.
very nice and likes to help people. there is a lot of homework which i guess is good. i feel like i deserved an A for the work i did but it's alright.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Worst Professor ever! Doesnt seem to care when students are struggling. Assigns too much homework. When you seek help she insults your math skills and seems put out and doesnt want to help you and tells you to retake pre-calc/trig. Goes over new material right before tests. A quiz every week. Gives worksheets to only half the class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Very understanding teacher who looks out for her students,I would take her again due to how much she tries to help the students. My only problem with her was that most of our 1 hour and 40 minute lectures would be spent working on one problem or her trying to explain a concept in a very odd way. gives a good bit of extra credit with quiz. not bad

There is a lot of material in this class, so she isn't able to teach everything in class. Although the online program ALEKS, made it super easy. Do all the ALEKS homework and come to class to get credit for the day and you can get a good grade. She is also super nice. 8/10
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great professor. Math is difficult, so dont be naive and think you will get an A just for showing up. If you do the homework, you should be fine. She is an excellent professor.

She's a nice lady, though hard to understand sometimes. HEAVY WORKLOAD. If any class, make time to study for this one. Calculus is a killer regardless of the teacher. Symbolab (website) is your best friend for the homework. She gives extra credit for quizzes, and makes reviews for tests that look very similar. Do those and you'll be alright.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: I already struggled with this part of college algebra and needed good explanations, but she does almost no lecture in her class and let's the ALEKS software do everything from homework to tests. In class, there are worksheets which are simply graded, but she provides only basic help and then the answers at end and mumbles the need to practice more.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: She is a good teacher that works with you. She is willing to help if you need it and gives good extra credit opportunities.

The class is not too bad. If you are someone who does not like using aleks (kinda like web assign) to help you learn do not take this class. I did not like her teaching style, she just basically went over problems. If you like professors who explain math by lectures do not take her. lots of opportunity for grades. Nice and caring

Ms O was a great teacher. Daily Classwork is graded more on completion than accuracy. They are meant to give you an opportunity to practice. She uses what is wrong to know what to go over again. Daily work reinforces ALEKS software leasons if youre on track. She does everything she can to help us succeed. I cant wait to take my next class with her!
got 92, 96, 98 on first three exams for trigonometry. super heavy workload due to learning on ALEKS platform. you learn everything yourself while class is used for worksheets, little lecture.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: She doesnt work well with students who are struggling. Shes tough luck professor. Unreliable office hours and doesnt live up to what is on the syllabus. Do not take her.

Awful. Had to debate grammar with her to get an explanation of the instructions, which had a different definition the next week. Only cares about her way of doing things, do not take her unless you know all the material and want to be condescended to. Used online ALEKS, never touched the book. Her accent is very easy to understand though.

This class was extremely easy. It is an actual class, but everything we did was on an online program. You mostly learn on the program, but she'll try to help you. She's doesn't respond to emails, but she is very nice lady. Almost half your grade is just completing the actual program, it's an easy A. Do the mid-term and final exam review.

I loved this professor. She is caring and understanding to students that actually show up to class and try. She is available outside of class and responds to emails. Attendance is not required, but come on people, it's a Calc class. If you don't show up, you won't do well on quizzes, which are weighted the same as the test category. Great teacher!
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Overall, this professor is a pretty good professor. As long as you can keep up with your lengthy list of course objectives for the week, you'll do fine. With that being said, make sure you don't fall behind. She gives a couple of worksheets that count as extra credit towards your final, DO THEM! Trust me, it helps. I got 7 extra points on my final.
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: For Calculus 1, she's a good professor. Her accent is easy to get use to, and her class wasn't that hard. Tests were fair and quizzes were easy. Overall if you put in the effort to understand the material and go to class, you'll be fine.

I hated this professor, when ever i met with her, she would just tell me look over the books material. Her tests are tough and i ended up withdrawing from the class. When you ask questions in class, shell ramble on and never answer your actual question. WOULDN'T RECOMMEND.

She does have a bit of a Russian/Latvian accent, but it's really easy to understand her. On quizzes and tests, you'll get at least half credit so long as you try. She actually wants you to learn and she always try to make her schedule open for you or at least gives you good material to study. She's funny in an awkward way, too.

The Homework she gives is online, and if reviewed it will help you on her tests, and expect a quiz every 2 weeks, and they weigh as much as the tests. She reviews examples of what is being learned so that you can better understand the material. Just study and do the hw and you will do well.

I think she was an excellent teacher. The pace that she followed was just right. You never felt like she was flying through material. After taking calculus twice before, i finally have a handle on whats going on. Uses Launchpad for HW assignments which she does give a lot but the due dates are fair. She definitely wants the class to be prepared.

She's a great professor. She does have an accent but she's easy to understand and tries her best to say things clearly. She assigns homework through mymathlab for a grade but it's usually 20 questions or so. Her tests aren't difficult if you pay attention and do the work. I highly recommend.

She's a really sweet woman and her class is really easy once you start understanding her accent. She assigns a lot of homework on Mymathlab, but usually it's only 20 questions. She offers multiple chances at extra credit, and is really good at explaining tough subjects. Would totally recommend her if you aren't good at math like me.

WARNING: if you have trouble understand accents, don't take this class. Besides that, she is a VERY kind and helpful professor. Willing to slow down or show more examples if you ask. MyMathLab is used for good practice, as well as a lot of extra credit assignments and studguides for the tests. Quizzes are easy if you take good notesfollow along

Sweetest lady ever. I was scared about the accent because of her reviews, but honestly it's barely even noticeable. MyMathLab homeworks range from 15-25 questions, she goes over the stuff before the quizzes, tests aren't too hard if you study for them, and she drops the lowest quiz grade. I HATE math but I love this class!
Nice lady tries hard to help you. Hard to understand. 3 tests and exam that are fairly easy if you study. Quizzes every week though along with mymathlab

She may not seem so at the beginning, but she's reeeeeally really nice. She'll do anything to help you achieve a better grade and is very helpful too. Tests are exactly like the study guide, so you'll do well if you actually study for them! Take her!

BEST TEACHER EVER! i came into the class scared and even got a really bad grade on the 1st exam but i managed to get a 100 in the class. She gives SOO many extra credit opportunities and is super helpful. Take her if you can and ignore the negative feedbacks. she's such a sweet lady.

She can have a confusing way of explaining things, but not enough to keep you from learning the material. Works through problems in baby steps. Pretty easy weekly quizzes. Study study study for tests! Gives many opportunities to get an A. Need the MML access code, but didn't use the online text book at all.

She has a thick Russian accent, so she's difficult to understand. There are SO MANY extra credit opportunities so get them done, not hard. Had a quiz almost every Monday (12 total), but they're usually 3-5 questions and are during the last 10 minutes of class. There were 3 tests and they weren't hard. She doesn't drop test grades.

She has an accent, but that doesn't make her any less of a professor. If you need her to slow down, she will. If you don't understand, she'll go over it again. Drops 3 of your lowest quiz grades & will give extra credit. She lets you know what to expect on quizzes & tests (only 3).  Also uses mymathlab. Taking her again next semester for precal (:

AVOID THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL COSTS. I haven't learned anything. No partial credit. No need for textbook unless for practice. Quiz every week. Hard to understand. If you are bad at Math, do NOT take her. I cannot stress it enough. HW is on MyMathLab, and homework is every week. Takes attendance because she has to. Won't affect your grade so she says.

Uses My Math Lab for Homework. Easy quizzes. Very lenient on giving partial credit on test. Very difficult to understand. Did not prepare me for Calc at all.   She is great for an easy A, however will not prepare you if you plan to continue in math.

Although she IS a sweetheart, and actually cares about your grade in the class, if you do NOT have a prior understanding in this material, you will struggle. I took precalculus in High School, and excelled. I got to this class, and yes I don't have to learn anything new, she overcomplicates concepts.

By far the best Math teacher I have meet. I walked in struggling and she was willing to help until i was able to bring my grade from a D to an B. quiz every tuesday two test and a final. she will let you drop the lowest test. I wish she I could choose her again. If you have the will she will show you the way.

Absolutely amazing. The sweetest lady you will ever meet, and will do anything to help you understand the material. She has a strong accent but you pay attention there should be no problem understanding the material. You do not need a book for her class nor does she penalize you for being absent

She was a great teacher! The test were easy, and she provided study guides that actually helped! The quizes are very simple and help your grade A LOT, as well as the home work! She lets students make up HW, quizes, and test! She honestly wants her students to succeed! I recommend taking her class!!
Super sweet lady! Heart of gold and wants her students to do well. I would take her again.

very nice and helpful with grades, drops two lowest quiz grades and give lots of extra credit on tests! dont need to buy the book, youll never use it. just my math lab. lots of quizzes but theyre all really easy, just like the homework. take this professor!

In my 2008 class I felt like I was taught a lot and also ways for me to teach students. In her class though I felt like I was in a 3rd grade classroom and all I did was copy notes and get unclear answers to my questions. I would not suggest this teacher.

Class is very easy. She gives quizzes often but most are just common sense especially if you have been attending class. Tests are the same way. She has an accent that gets hard to understand but I would recommend taking this class if you are an education major especially! Easy A as long as you put in at least some effort!

Really enjoyed her class. Accent is a little strong but not too bad. Her tests and quizzes are easy as long as you study. Homework pretty much every day but its very easy and quick. I recommend taking her if you can get her.

I found this teacher to be easy and very helpful.  She does have an accent but it's easy to get over that.  The tests are easy as long as you study.  She does assign homework fairly often, but it's quick and easy. As long as you make an attempt in this class, you will have no trouble passing. I would recommend this teacher for everyone to take.

I would not suggest taking this class to anyone. I took AP Calc in high school and made an A but I have no idea what is going on in this class most of the time. She is almost impossible to understand and the tests do not match what she attempts to teach in class. She seems like a nice lady but should maybe rethink her profession.

Do not take this class if you want to pass. Her tests are hard, TONS of homework, quizzes every class. Non of the things she teaches match the quiz or test. unclear! teaches to the ground. She is approachable & a nice lady but awful teacher! Very heavy accent. hard to understand.
